greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number having exactly n square divisors.
comment: all terms are smooth squares: if prime(k) is a factor of a(n) then also prime(i) are factors, i<k;
if prime(j) is the greatest prime factor of a(n) then a(2*n) = a(n)*prime(j+1)^2;
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Smooth Number
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=1); while(sumdiv(k, d, issquare(d)) != n, k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 15 2019
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 20 2007
